title: Inside Line Equipment Frame Bag
content:
Bay Area bag maker Inside Line Equipment just announced its all-new Frame Bag ($120). This simple, universal bag is designed to stash, store, carry and organize, with internal dividers for tools, shell layers and small things. A phone pocket, easily accessible while riding. Slots to hold a pump and Dynaplug. Securely attaches to your frame, with minimal vibration…

Specs:

  • Weather-resistant construction
  • Dual-sided entry with mesh pockets for essentials
  • Internal elastic for securing a frame pump as well as tool storage/ CO2 / Dynaplug
  • Multiple velcro attachment options to fit various bike sizes. Includes 5 low profile Velcro straps that can be cut to length (Frame tape at contact points is recommended to protect the bicycle finish)
  • Water-resistant YKK Uretek Zippers
  • High Performance Cordura, XPAC Sailcloth, or Waxed Canvas
  • Dimensions: 14″ (35.6 cm) x 6″ (15.2 cm) x 2.5″ (6.4 cm) – (3 L)
  • Handmade in California

See more at Inside Line Equipment.

The post Inside Line Equipment Frame Bag appeared first on The Radavist.
author: John Watson
